column5: Surface 75 F this afternoon on Pigeon.  That’s way up from a week ago. Took a dip. She’s way cooler down below. The boys weren’t too happy ?
74 last night in the parry sound area.  Was 68 the week before and 62 the week before that.  cheers
Monday Simcoe deep water was 18.9 C  surface. Pulled the anchor rope up from 115 fow. It was cool,not cold. Crazy with the colder then norm June we had.
74 on GPool today.  Things are on the rise.
Amazing what that very hot sun can do over a few days! I have noticed the same thing. Water temps much cooler than normal for the time of year.....then suddenly they took a jump!
Surface temps in am 75. By evening 82.   Fishing has  slowed down.
Saw 77.9 today.  All this heat this fast definitely has put the fish down a bit.  Although I did get a couple of really nice smallies off edges with spybaits this morning.   Fun technique.
I am just happy I can have my feet in the water while out on the toon again Bill. My baffins have been killer.LMAO Lets see what the deeps bring in the morning.
82 last night!   Not even a bite so glad it wasn’t just me.  Going to try again tonight! cheers
26.4 C this morning. Pulling the anchor up from 122 fow, the rope and anchor were warm. WOW.
those largies are gonna be eating frogs!
On Big Rideau last weekend we had surface temps as high as 84-85 degrees! Fishing was tough!
Saw 71-72 out on Gbay yesterday.  Spybaits were lighting up the smallies!
Low 80's last night in the kawarthas. She's HOT! S.
Saw almost 80 yesterday evening on the upper Severn.   Crappies were already in the spots I was hoping they were, lol!
Simcoe (mouth of the bay ) drop to 19 C. Refreshing dipping the feet in on the toon.
